text: diabetes may be present before pregnancy
or may develop during pregnancy itself
if you develop diabetes during pregnancy
it will most likely be a specific type
of diabetes known as gestational
diabetes blood sugar levels are
important for all mothers to being with
diabetes as well controlled blood
glucose levels can significantly improve
the likelihood of having a healthy baby
the NHS states that the target hba1c for
mothers before and during pregnancy is
forty-three millimoles per mole if you
have diabetes before your pregnancy the
NHS advises achieving the target hba1c
before conceiving the target hba1c may
require dedication to reach but it's
important that you strive to achieve it
you may find that regular blood glucose
monitoring including before each meal
and one hour after may help you to
achieve good blood glucose levels if
blood glucose levels are higher than
recommended you may need to change your
medication regime in order to help lower
your blood glucose levels your health
team should be able to provide you with
advice on managing blood glucose levels
throughout your pregnancy
sometimes the emphasis on achieving
tight blood glucose control may result
in hypoglycemia particularly amongst
those using insulin your health team
should be able to ensure that you know
how to spot and treat hypoglycemia
